ygData.subject: Re: rez question
ygData.msgSnippet: actually, that does make a lot of sense.....it would seem that hte higher lv you are, the more exp you can give back.....i just know now that i have to go thru
ygData.messageBody:
actually, that does make a lot of sense.....it would seem that hte higher lv you
are, the more exp you can give back.....i just know now that i have to go thru
hell all over again....lv 40's gonna SUCK majorly......o btw, i have a question
about the staff of the observer while i'm thinking about it....it has one charge
of the sentinel spell....<which is a crock ir should be unlimited like the
jboots> but is there anyway to recharge it or maybe does it recharge on it's own
<that was suggested to me by a guildmate> or do i just have to get a new staff?
which would suck there too....any info would be greatly appreciated on this...i
love that staff, and the sentinel effect was really kewl and would come in handy
in places like cazic and lower guk....

(\/)ystix Spellchaser
lv 40 cleric of The Rathe

Heather M. Daley wrote:

> From: "Heather M. Daley" <blushn@...>
>
> Res not only depends on which form you use but also the level of the person
> you use it on, i am lvl 34 now and of course mine gives back no XP at all, i
> have been resed by a 39 cleric and have noticed a slight change in my XP
> nothing really noteable, however just last night 2 party members died just
> before I arrived in Solusek's Eye. there was a lvl 49 cleric there , of
> course with the best res spell, my wizard friend who is also lvl 34 got half
> a bubble of XP back, however, my paladin friend who is in Hell lvl 30, those
> of you who have reached 30 know about this, he did not notice any movement
> in his XP bar after res.
>
> Hope this helps
> Bree Wyndsdale
> 34th Cleric of Fennin Ro
